items.title: Bipartisan House Group Proposes Long-Shot Health Care Plan
items.summary: Republicans and Democrats released a two-year plan to scale back and extend expiring Affordable Care Act subsidies, but it faces long odds in the G.O.P.-led House.

items.title: Boat Strike Video Shown to Lawmakers
items.summary: Gen. Dan Caine, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and Adm. Frank M. Bradley, commander of the operation, met with members of Congress behind closed doors.

items.title: False U.S.G.S. Report of 5.9 Earthquake Sends Phones Buzzing in Nevada
items.summary: The United States Geological Survey quickly deleted the alert, saying it had been sent in error. “This isn’t a good look,” one earthquake expert said.

items.title: Her Roof Was About to Be Fixed. Then Immigration Agents Showed Up.
items.summary: The Trump administration’s deportation agenda is reverberating beyond immigrant communities as agents begin fanning out around New Orleans.

items.title: Suspect Arrested in Inquiry Into Pipe Bombs in D.C. Ahead of Jan. 6 Riot
items.summary: The suspect was described as a 30-year-old man from Prince William County, Va., and his arrest could ultimately provide an answer to one of the mysteries arising from the Jan. 6. attack.

items.title: Poll Suggests Voters May Blame Republicans More if Affordable Care Act Subsidies Go Away
items.summary: About half of people covered under the Affordable Care Act say that if their health costs spike, it will have a “major impact” on how they vote in the 2026 midterm elections, a survey found.

items.title: Top Democrat calls navy admiral briefing about ‘double-tap’ strike on vessels ‘one of the most troubling things I’ve seen’– live
items.summary: <p>Adm Frank Bradley spoke to lawmakers in a private session on the suspected drug boats; Jim Hines tells CNN the briefing was troubling but Bradley confirmed there was not a ‘kill them all’ order</p><p><strong>Among the beneficiaries of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a>’s pardons and commutations, there is a group that legal experts and political scientists see as some of the clearest evidence of how such actions undermine the rule of law: those who were released from prison and again arrested for different alleged crimes</strong>.</p><p>During his first term, Trump issued 237 acts of clemency – including to someone who was a predatory lender and drug smuggler and to another who ran a Ponzi scheme. Since taking office again, Trump has issued more than 1,600, most for people involved in the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jan/20/trump-executive-orders-jan-6-pardons">January 6 attack</a> on Congress.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/dec/04/us-politics-live-donald-trump-latest-news-updates-democrats-republicans">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Arrest reportedly made in case of pipe bombs planted on eve of US Capitol riot
items.summary: <p>Bombs were placed near Republican and Democratic party HQs in Washington night before 6 January 2021 attack</p><p>US authorities have made an arrest in connection with pipe bombs that were planted outside the headquarters of both the Democratic and Republican parties in Washington DC on the eve of 6 January 2021, according to reports on Thursday morning.</p><p>Explosive devices were placed at night and then, on the afternoon of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2022/dec/23/jan-6-panel-final-report-trump-capitol-attack">6 January</a>, the US Capitol attack occurred, when a mob of Donald Trump’s supporters stormed Congress in an effort to prevent the certification of Joe Biden’s win in the 2020 presidential election.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/04/dc-pipe-bomb-attack-arrest-january-6">Continue reading...</a>
